byline.contributor: Niraj Chokshi, Jack Begg and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

abstract: Gen John W Vessey Jr, longest serving active duty soldier who eventually became chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff in Reagan administration, dies at age 94.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: General Vessey was regarded as a leader of proven courage and integrity who inspired confidence, and he was also an old-fashioned patriot.
snippet: General Vessey was regarded as a leader of proven courage and integrity who inspired confidence, and he was also an old-fashioned patriot....

headline.main: John W. Vessey Jr., Who Was Chairman of Joint Chiefs, Dies at 94
headline.print_headline: Gen. John W. Vessey Jr., Who Was Chairman  of Joint Chiefs, Dies at 94
